newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asian dollar deposits softer before payroll figure.
newsitem.headline: Asian dollar deposits softer before payroll figure.

text.p: Asian dollar deposit rates were slightly lower in thin trade with most traders sidelined before Friday's issue of the U.S. payroll employment figures, dealers said on Thursday.
The U.S. jobless claims was forecast to be around 320,000 compared with 322,000 reported in the previous report.
"The market seemed quiet although rates were a little bit softer this morning with most traders waiting for new positions before Friday's U.S payroll employment numbers," a local dealer said.
In short dates, Thursday/Friday, weekend and week-fixed slipped 1/16 percentage point to a common 5-5/8 5-1/2 percent respectively.

Among term rates, one month was unchanged from Wednesday's 5-11/16 5-9/16 percent, three-months unchanged at 5-13/16 5-11/16 percent, nine-months remained steady at 6-1/16 5-15/16 and twelve-months was steady at 6-3/16 6-1/16 percent.
